Job Position:&nbsp;Customer Service Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Summary


	The Customer Service Executive will serve as the primary point of contact for customers across the company&rsquo;s logistics, e-commerce, and food-delivery services.
	The role is responsible for handling inquiries, resolving complaints, managing order-related issues, and ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction.
	This position is critical to customer retention, brand trust, and service excellence in a fast-paced startup environment.

	Handle customer inquiries, complaints, and requests via phone, WhatsApp, email, social media, and in-app channels.
	Provide accurate information on pricing, services, order status, delivery timelines, and policies.

	Support customer on-boarding, service activation, and usage education.
	Identify recurring issues and provide feedback to management for process improvement.

	Food Delivery: Handle order issues, missing items, late deliveries, rider availability concerns, and merchant-related complaints.

	International Logistics: Assist customers with shipment tracking, documentation guidance, and delivery updates.
	Customer Retention: Support loyalty programs, reactivation efforts, and customer feedback initiatives.


Requirements


	Minimum HND or Degree in Customer Service, Business Administration, Communications, or related field.
	1&ndash;3 years of experience in customer service or call-center roles (logistics, e-commerce, or food delivery experience is an advantage).

	Ability to handle high-volume customer interactions calmly and professionally.
	Good problem-solving, conflict resolution, and multitasking skills.
	Basic computer proficiency and experience with CRM or customer support tools.
	Good understanding of Nigerian customer behavior and service expectations.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 monthly.

title: Job Vacancies at Watolex Crown Integrated Service
content:
Watolex Crown Integrated Service is a premier human resources consulting firm dedicated to providing comprehensive solutions in recruitment, capacity building, and management consultancy. Our mission is to meet the evolving needs of our clients through unwavering professionalism and exceptional customer service. Driven by a pursuit of excellence, we strive to enhance every aspect of our operations, ensuring optimal outcomes for our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Trainee Engineer

Job Location: Mushin, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking an enthusiastic Trainee Engineer to support on-site construction activities across building projects.
	Reporting to the Senior/Site Manager, you will assist with day-to-day supervision, quality checks, basic layout and measurements, and maintaining accurate site records while learning practical site engineering skills.


Responsibilities


	Assist with daily on-site supervision to ensure work follows approved drawings, specifications and schedules.
	Read and apply architectural and structural drawings for on-site execution.
	Carry out setting-out, measurements and basic surveying tasks under supervision.
	Support routine quality checks and inspections (concrete, reinforcement, finishes) and raise non-conformance reports.
	Maintain accurate site records: daily reports, material logs, progress photos and attendance sheets.
	Monitor material usage on site and liaise with procurement/logistics to report shortfalls or delays.
	Help coordinate contractors, subcontractors and site staff to keep workflow smooth.
	Report site issues promptly and support senior staff to implement corrective actions.
	Enforce safety procedures and environmental guidelines on site.
	Attend site meetings and prepare clear progress updates for the project team.


Requirement


	Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering or closely related discipline.
	0 – 2 years of practical experience.
	Ability to read and interpret structural and architectural drawings.
	Basic competence with AutoCAD and Microsoft Office (Excel/Word); willingness to learn project management tools.
	Good numeracy, attention to detail and practical problem-solving skills.
	Strong communication and teamwork skills; ability to take direction and learn on the job.
	Knowledge of basic construction methods, materials and health & safety practices.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 / month

Application Closing Date: 2nd February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: infowatolexcis@gmail.com using "Trainee Engineer" as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Customer Service Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Customer Service Executive will serve as the primary point of contact for customers across the company’s logistics, e-commerce, and food-delivery services.
	The role is responsible for handling inquiries, resolving complaints, managing order-related issues, and ensuring a high level of customer satisfaction.
	This position is critical to customer retention, brand trust, and service excellence in a fast-paced startup environment.


Responsibilities


	Handle customer inquiries, complaints, and requests via phone, WhatsApp, email, social media, and in-app channels.
	Provide accurate information on pricing, services, order status, delivery timelines, and policies.
	Log, track, and resolve customer issues including delayed deliveries, missing items, rider issues, payment concerns, and refunds.
	Escalate complex or unresolved issues to Operations, Fleet, or Management in line with escalation procedures.
	Coordinate with riders, warehouse teams, merchants, and partners to ensure timely issue resolution.
	Maintain detailed and accurate customer interaction records using CRM or support tools.
	Follow up with customers to confirm issue resolution and satisfaction.
	Support customer on-boarding, service activation, and usage education.
	Identify recurring issues and provide feedback to management for process improvement.
	Meet daily, weekly, and monthly service performance targets.


Job – Specific Responsibilities


	Food Delivery: Handle order issues, missing items, late deliveries, rider availability concerns, and merchant-related complaints.
	Local Logistics: Support pickup and delivery scheduling, parcel tracking, COD issues, and sender/receiver inquiries.
	E-commerce Fulfillment: Manage customer inquiries related to storage, order processing, fulfillment timelines, and delivery status.
	International Logistics: Assist customers with shipment tracking, documentation guidance, and delivery updates.
	Customer Retention: Support loyalty programs, reactivation efforts, and customer feedback initiatives.


Requirements


	Minimum HND or Degree in Customer Service, Business Administration, Communications, or related field.
	1–3 years’ experience in customer service or call-center roles (logistics, e-commerce, or food delivery experience is an advantage).
	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to handle high-volume customer interactions calmly and professionally.
	Good problem-solving, conflict resolution, and multitasking skills.
	Basic computer proficiency and experience with CRM or customer support tools.

N250,000 - N350,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 2nd February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: infowatolexcis@gmail.com using "Customer Service" as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Digital Marketer

Job Location: Ogba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Digital Marketer is responsible for driving online customer acquisition, engagement, and revenue growth through digital channels.
	This role will plan, execute, and optimize digital campaigns across logistics, e-commerce, and food delivery services, using data-driven strategies to increase brand visibility, orders, and customer retention


Responsibilities


	Develop and execute digital marketing strategies to drive customer acquisition, order volume, and revenue growth.
	Plan, launch, and optimize paid campaigns across Meta (Facebook/Instagram), Google Ads, and other relevant platforms.
	Manage organic digital channels including social media, email, SMS, website content, and landing pages.
	Collaborate with Product, Sales, Operations, and Customer Service teams to align campaigns with service readiness and business priorities.
	Track and analyze campaign performance including CAC, CTR, conversions, ROAS, engagement, and retention.
	Create content calendars, campaign messaging, creatives, and promotional offers aligned with brand guidelines.
	Run A/B tests on creatives, messaging, offers, and audience segments to improve performance.
	Manage digital marketing vendors, agencies, and tools where required.
	Monitor competitor digital activities and recommend growth interventions.
	Prepare weekly and monthly performance reports with insights and recommendations.


Job Specific Responsibilities


	Food Delivery: Run meal-time campaigns, merchant promotions, location-based targeting, and retention offers.
	Local Logistics: Promote express delivery, same-day services, zonal pricing, and micro-hub activation campaigns.
	E-commerce Fulfillment: Drive awareness and lead generation for fulfillment, storage, packaging, and delivery services.
	International Logistics: Support digital awareness campaigns for cross-border shipping and personal import/export services.
	Customer Loyalty: Execute referral programs, discount cycles, reactivation campaigns, and repeat-user incentives.


Requirements


	Degree or HND in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field with 2–4 years of experience in digital or performance marketing (logistics, e-commerce, or food delivery experience is an advantage).
	Strong hands-on experience with Meta Ads, Google Ads, analytics dashboards, and email/SMS automation tools.
	Proven ability to run acquisition-focused campaigns and optimize for conversion.
	Strong analytical, reporting, and optimization skills.
	Good understanding of Nigerian consumer behavior and digital trends.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 1st February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: infowatolexcis@gmail.com using "Digital Marketer" as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Hrchi Consulting
content:
Hrchi Consulting, a versatile HR Consulting Firm, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Nurse

Job Location: Anthony village, Lagos
Job Field: Medical / Healthcare
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Psychiatric Nurse will work as part of a team of medical professionals to provide psychiatric nursing care to patients of all ages, gender, religion, and disposition while creating a safe and therapeutic environment to aid their mental stability.


Job Description
     

            
    




	Provide mental health care treatment for patients
	Best practice documentation for patients treatment plan
	Manage confidential information with the utmost respect for the patient
	Work with a team of Multi-Disciplinary experts to provide care for patients
	Exercise independent judgment in medical emergencies
	Demonstrate tact, diplomacy, patience, and compassion
	Establish and maintain working relationships with co-workers, other agencies, and organizations
	Comply with nursing policies, protocols, and program regulations.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree.
	Must have 1 - 3 years of work experience as a psychiatric nurse.
	Must be a Registered Psychiatric Nurse.
	Must be medically and physically fit.
	Must possess a valid licence.


Salary
N160,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Aplication 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chineduashibuogwu4@gmail.com or hrchiconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Medical Doctor

Job Location: Anthony village, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Respond to patients’ medical problems by referring to their history, carrying out diagnosis, treatment, counseling and referral, where necessary.
	Order lab tests and interpret the test results.
	Maintain confidentiality and impartiality at all times.
	Collect, record and maintain sensitive patient information such as examination results, medical history and reports.
	Perform minor surgeries.
	Explain procedures or prescribed treatments to patients.
	Liaise with medical professionals in the community and hospitals.
	Promote health education in conjunction with other health professionals.
	Meet targets set by government for specified treatments eg. child immunization.
	Discuss and evaluate new pharmaceutical products with pharmaceutical representatives.
	Keep up-to-date with medical developments, treatment and medication.
	Teach at hospitals and medical schools, and observe and assess the work of trainee doctors and medical students.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chineduashibuogwu4@gmail.com or hrchiconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Teacher

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Who is a Teacher? A Teacher is an educator responsible for planning, delivering, and assessing lessons to students in various subjects and grade levels, facilitating learning and academic development in accordance with curriculum standards and educational objectives.


Job Brief


	As a Teacher, you will create engaging and interactive learning experiences, provide instruction in your subject area(s), and support the intellectual, social, and emotional growth of students.
	Your role involves designing lesson plans, implementing instructional strategies, and evaluating student progress to promote academic success and lifelong learning.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement lesson plans, instructional materials, and teaching strategies aligned with curriculum standards and educational objectives.
	Deliver engaging and interactive classroom instruction, using a variety of teaching methods, technologies, and resources to accommodate diverse learning styles and preferences.
	Create a positive and supportive learning environment conducive to student engagement, collaboration, and academic achievement.
	Assess student learning and progress through formative and summative assessments, quizzes, tests, projects, and assignments.
	Provide constructive feedback, guidance, and support to students to help them develop their academic skills, critical thinking abilities, and problem-solving skills.
	Differentiate instruction and provide individualized support and enrichment opportunities for students with diverse learning needs and abilities.
	Foster a culture of respect, inclusivity, and mutual respect among students, promoting positive behavior and social-emotional development.
	Collaborate with colleagues, parents, and stakeholders to support student success, address academic challenges, and enhance the overall educational experience.
	Participate in professional development activities, workshops, and training sessions to enhance teaching skills, stay updated on educational trends, and implement best practices.
	Maintain accurate records of student attendance, grades, and academic performance, and communicate progress reports to parents and guardians as needed.
	Incorporate technology and digital tools into instruction to enhance learning outcomes, communication, and collaboration.
	Stay updated on curriculum standards, educational policies, and assessment practices, and integrate them into instructional planning and delivery.
	Implement classroom management strategies and disciplinary procedures to maintain a positive and safe learning environment for all students.
	Participate in extracurricular activities, clubs, and events to support student interests and promote holistic development.
	Demonstrate professionalism, integrity, and ethical behavior in all interactions with students, colleagues, and stakeholders, serving as a role model for students.


Requirements and Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in education, teaching, or a related field; master's degree or teaching certification may be required for some positions.
	Valid teaching license or certification issued by the appropriate state or local education authority.
	Proven experience in teaching, preferably in the subject area(s) and grade level(s) assigned.
	Strong knowledge of subject matter content, instructional strategies, and pedagogical approaches relevant to the assigned subject area(s).
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to connect with students, parents, and colleagues effectively.
	Classroom management skills and the ability to create a positive and supportive learning environment conducive to student success.
	Adaptability and flexibility to meet the diverse needs of students and adjust instructional approaches accordingly.
	Passion for teaching and a commitment to fostering academic excellence, critical thinking, and lifelong learning in students.
	Technological proficiency and the ability to integrate educational technology into instruction to enhance learning outcomes.
	Professionalism, integrity, and ethical behavior in all aspects of teaching and educational practice.


Required Skills:


	Lesson planning
	Instructional delivery
	Classroom management
	Assessment and feedback
	Differentiated instruction
	Communication skills
	Collaboration
	Technology integration
	Adaptability
	Professionalism.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chineduashibuogwu4@gmail.com or hrchiconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at West African Ceramics Limited
content:
A leading Manufacturer of high quality building material in Nigeria. With over 30 years of expertise, we provide a wide range of top tier products, including Tiles, Marbles, granite, adhesives, grouts and light steel gauge profiles, all meticulously crafted to meet International standards.

We take pride in offering a quality alternative to imported materials, supporting the growth of Nigeria's construction industry

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Electrical Incharge Officer

Job Location: Ajaokuta, Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are looking for a skilled and proactive Electrical Incharge Officer to oversee all electrical operations, maintenance, and projects within our facility.
	The role requires hands-on expertise in electrical systems, strong leadership in managing a technical team, and the ability to ensure uninterrupted power supply and compliance with safety standards.
	The ideal candidate will have prior experience in industrial or manufacturing environments.


Key Responsibilities
Operations & Maintenance:


	Supervise day-to-day electrical maintenance activities across the plant.
	Ensure smooth functioning of electrical equipment, machinery, and power distribution systems.
	Troubleshoot and resolve electrical breakdowns promptly to minimize downtime.


Project Management:


	Plan and execute electrical installations, upgrades, and preventive maintenance schedules.
	Coordinate with contractors and vendors for electrical projects and equipment procurement.
	Monitor project timelines, budgets, and quality standards.


Safety & Compliance:


	Ensure adherence to electrical safety protocols and statutory regulations.
	Conduct regular inspections and audits of electrical systems.
	Train team members on safe electrical practices and emergency procedures.


Team Leadership:


	Lead and mentor a team of electricians and technicians.
	Allocate tasks, monitor performance, and provide technical guidance.
	Foster a culture of accountability and continuous improvement.


Qualifications & Experience


	Diploma / Degree in Electrical Engineering or related field.
	5+ years of experience in electrical maintenance and operations, preferably in manufacturing/industrial plants.
	Strong knowledge of electrical systems, PLCs, motors, transformers, and power distribution.
	Familiarity with safety standards (e.g., OSHA, ISO, NFPA).
	Proven ability to manage teams and coordinate with cross-functional departments.
	Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills.


Key Competencies:


	Technical expertise in electrical systems and troubleshooting.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Attention to detail and commitment to safety.
	Ability to work under pressure and handle emergencies.
	Good communication and reporting skills.


Application Closing Date: 16th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: recruitment@royal-ceramic.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Store Incharge Officer

Job Location: Ajaokuta, Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	To manage end-to-end store operations including receipt, storage, inventory control, and issuance of materials while ensuring compliance with company SOPs, ERP accuracy, safety standards, and effective coordination with internal stakeholders.


Key Roles & Responsibilities
Receiving & Verification of Materials:


	Receive materials from suppliers and verify against purchase orders and delivery documents.
	Conduct quantity and basic quality checks upon receipt.
	Prepare and post Goods Receipt Notes (GRN) accurately in ERP systems.


Storage & Organization:


	Allocate appropriate bin locations and maintain bin cards.
	Implement FIFO/FEFO methods for material handling.
	Ensure proper stacking, labeling, and safe storage of materials including heavy slabs and chemicals.


Inventory Control:


	Maintain daily stock ledgers and real-time inventory records in ERP.
	Monitor minimum, maximum, and reorder levels.
	Conduct regular cycle counts and periodic physical stock verification.


Issuance & Dispatch:


	Issue materials strictly against approved indents.
	Ensure correct unit of measurement (UOM) during material issuance.
	Prepare packing lists and coordinate safe loading and dispatch of materials.


ERP & Documentation:


	Perform accurate ERP entries for GRN, material issues, returns, and stock adjustments.
	Maintain store-related SOPs, records, and documentation.
	Ensure audit readiness and compliance with internal and external audits.


Compliance & Safety:


	Enforce Health, Safety & Environment (HSE) standards within the store.
	Ensure mandatory PPE usage and compliance with chemical handling protocols.
	Maintain 5S housekeeping standards in the warehouse.


Coordination & Communication:


	Liaise with Procurement for material planning and shortages.
	Coordinate with Production for material availability and consumption.
	Work closely with Quality for material inspection and acceptance criteria.


Loss & Cost Control:


	Minimize handling damage and material losses.
	Monitor scrap segregation and disposal.
	Reduce material expiry and write-offs through effective FEFO implementation.


Specific Remarks


	Candidate must have hands-on ERP experience in store and inventory operations.
	Must be familiar with safe handling and storage of heavy slabs and chemical products.
	Strict adherence to company SOPs and HSE standardsis mandatory.
	Preference will be given to candidates with prior experience in marble, granite, or similar building materials industries.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of store and inventory management practices
	Hands-on experience with ERP systems
	Proficiency in MS Excel and basic reporting
	High attention to detail and record accuracy
	Good communication skills in English and local language
	Strong coordination and problem-solving abilities.


Application Closing Date: 15th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: recruitment@royal-ceramic.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Mechanical Fitter

Job Location: Ajaokuta, Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilledMechanical Fitterwith hands-on experience in the installation, maintenance, and repair ofcompressors, pumps, and rotating equipment. The role involves ensuring optimal performance, reliability, and safety of mechanical systems in industrial environments.


Key Responsibilities
Installation & Assembly:


	Fit, align, and assemble compressors, pumps, valves, and piping systems.
	Interpret engineering drawings, schematics, and technical manuals.


?Maintenance & Repair:


	Conduct routine inspections, preventive maintenance, and troubleshooting.
	Dismantle, repair, and reassemble mechanical components.
	Replace worn-out parts, bearings, seals, and gaskets.


Testing & Quality Assurance:


	Perform operational tests to verify equipment performance.
	Ensure compliance with safety standards and manufacturer specifications.


Qualifications & Skills


	Diploma / Certificate in Mechanical Engineering or related field.
	Proven experience (3–7 years) as a Mechanical Fitter in industrial settings.
	Strong knowledge of compressors, pumps, and rotating equipment.
	Ability to read and interpret mechanical drawings and technical documents.
	Proficiency with hand tools, power tools, and precision measuring instruments.
	Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Commitment to safety and quality standards.


Application Closing Date: 10th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: recruitment@royal-ceramic.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
